title: R in Action Chapter 1
text:
R uses the symbol <- for assignments (alternative: =).

x <- 5  # Preferred assignment operator
x = 5   # Also works in most cases







.libPaths("C:/Software/R_Stack/R-4.5.2/library")
# Sets the directory where R looks for installed packages
# My packages are stored in "C:/Software/R_Stack/R-4.5.2/library"





getwd()                        # Check current working directory


#example only do not run
setwd("C:/Your/Path/Here")     # Change working directory manually

Alternative ways to set the working directory in RStudio:

Session → Set Working Directory → Choose Directory
File → New Project → New Directory (for a fresh project) or Existing Directory





ls()                              # List objects in the workspace
rm(object_list)                   # Remove one or more objects (replace object_list)
options()                         # View current options
options(digits = 3)               # Example: limit displayed decimal places
save.image("myfile.RData")        # Save entire workspace
save(object_list, file = "myfile.RData")  # Save specific objects
load("myfile.RData")              # Load a saved workspace
help(options)                     # Documentation for options






Execute current line/chunk: Ctrl + Enter
Run entire script: Ctrl + Shift + Enter
Insert code chunk (in Quarto/R Markdown): Ctrl + Alt + I





help.start()                      # Open general help page
help("function_name")             # Help for a specific function
?function_name                    # Shortcut for help()
help.search("keyword")            # Search help files
example("function_name")          # Run examples for a function
data()                            # List built-in datasets
vignette()                        # List available vignettes
vignette("topic")                 # View specific vignette





install.packages("package_name")   # Install a package (replace with actual name)
library()                         # List currently loaded packages
search()                          # Show attached packages and objects
update.packages()                 # Update all installed packages
installed.packages()              # List all installed packages on your system
help(package = "package_name")    # Documentation for an installed package







age <- c(1, 3, 5, 2, 11, 9, 3, 9, 12, 3)
weight <- c(4.4, 5.3, 7.2, 5.2, 8.5, 7.3, 6.0, 10.4, 10.2, 6.1)
mean(weight)

[1] 7.06

sd(weight)

[1] 2.077498

cor(age, weight)

[1] 0.9075655

plot(age, weight)

This chapter serves as a beginner-friendly guide to starting with R and RStudio, focusing on essential setup and tools for efficient workflow.
Key Topics Covered:

Assignment Operator: Introduction to <- (preferred) and = for assigning values.
Environment Setup:

Configuring library paths (.libPaths()).
Managing working directory (getwd(), setwd(), or via RStudio menus/projects).
Workspace functions (ls(), rm(), options(), save.image(), load()).

RStudio Shortcuts: Quick keys for running code and inserting chunks (Ctrl+Enter, Ctrl+Shift+Enter, Ctrl+Alt+I).
Help System: Using built-in help (help(), ?, help.search(), example(), vignette(), etc.).
Package Management: Installing, loading, updating, and exploring packages (install.packages(), library(), update.packages(), etc.).
Practical Examples:

A simple data analysis session with vectors, basic statistics (mean(), sd(), cor()), and plotting.
Working with the vcd package (installation demonstration and usage of the Arthritis dataset).

The chapter emphasizes foundational skills to build confidence in R, highlighting how mastering the environment, shortcuts, and help resources boosts productivity for data analysis and beyond. All demonstrative code is shown but not executed automatically, while the core sample session runs to produce output.
